alert.note: Alert for Arkansas; Jefferson; Lonoke; Monroe; Prairie (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 11:22AM CDT until April 05 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Prairie County in central Arkansas... Southeastern Lonoke County in central Arkansas... Monroe County in eastern Arkansas... North central Jefferson County in southeastern Arkansas... Northern Arkansas County in southeastern Arkansas... * Until noon CDT. * At 1122 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Parkers Corner to Brummitt to near Altheimer, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Stuttgart... Clarendon... Altheimer... Holly Grove... Humphrey... Almyra... St. Charles... Ulm... Roe... Peppers Landing... Brummitt... Parkers Corner... Palmer... Stuttgart Municipal Airport... De Witt... Wabbaseka... Blackton... Aberdeen... Slovak... Almyra Airport... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for central, eastern and southeastern Arkansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for central, eastern and southeastern Arkansas.
